name: AcneTipsbyVoiceFirstHealth
0:
”Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?”
”Alexa, what's in the news?”
skdetail:
Flash Briefing Skill
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Practical tips to help you control your acne so you can live a confident life with healthy looking skin!

Whether you, or someone you know, has been struggling with acne, this flash briefing covers the top tips and tricks to help you better manage the diagnosis, and make sure that you live a confident life with healthy and radiant looking skin! Learn more about what acne is and how you can stay in control of your skin by tuning in daily for an acne tip in this flash briefing by Voice First Health. 

We cover all the key topics: diagnosis, treatment, risk factors, topical and oral medications (e.g. hormonal, antibiotics, isotretinoin), tests, lifestyle modifications (exercise, smoking cessation, and nutrition, to name just a few) and much more. Whether you have mild, moderate, or severe acne; blackheads or whiteheads, pimples, nodular or cystic acne, this is a treasure trove of information that you can apply to your life right away so you can optimize your skin care right now. Wondering about some of those acne myths? Chocolate? Caffeine? Greasy Food? We've got you covered as well. Learn how to decrease the risk of scarring and other potential complications of acne. And that's just the beginning of what we have in store for you!

Just say, "Alexa, enable Acne Tips" and start taking control of your acne today!

** Be sure to check out our other educational healthcare flash briefings in the Voice First Health series by searching for "Voice First Health" or visiting https://VoiceFirstHealth.com **

ABOUT US:
Acne Tips is hosted by Catherine Lim, a medical student at the University of British Columbia with an interest in technology and medical education. 

Dr. Teri Fisher, MD, is a physician and Clinical Assistant Professor at the University of British Columbia. He is an experienced TEDx and keynote speaker, teacher, podcaster, and briefcaster with a passion for education and voice technology. He is the Founder of Voice First Health, the leading series of evidence-based educational healthcare flash briefings. He is also the founder of Briefcast.FM, the premier flash briefing network. 

ABOUT VOICE FIRST HEALTH:
Voice First Health is the industry-leading series of flash briefings at the intersection of voice technology and healthcare education. All information is evidence-based and is geared towards providing practical health care tips to improve overall health and wellness. For more information, feel free to visit https://VoiceFirstHealth.com

PLEASE NOTE:
All information provided in this flash briefing is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, treatment, or care. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider concerning any questions you may have regarding any information obtained from this flash briefing and any medical condition you believe may be relevant to you or to someone else. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay in seeking it because of something you have heard on this flash briefing. Always consult with your physician or other qualified healthcare provider before embarking on a new treatment, diet, or fitness program.
